intro: Psychotria cabrae, commonly known as the "Cabrae Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Psychotria cabrae is also noted for its role in the ecological interactions of its habitat, particularly as a host plant for certain species of insects.
